Summary: The Kids are OK, I think ‚Äî They are Doing Solo Shows
Description:
The Kids are Ok, I Think - They are Doing Solo Shows
A night of new works

Featuring
Marissa Goldman: Gamer Girl
Fareeha Khan: 7th Grade Funny
Ian Lockwood: I Got To Be Me

Hosted by the Marvelous Ms. Meaghan Strickland

Suggested donation of $5-$10 at the door

There is a legend around these parts. The legend foretells a great darkness sweeping over the land. A great, over-powering force that will decimate our land and leave naught but ash in its wake. The signs are clear. The darkness is coming and all are in danger.

The legend does not end there, however. The legend also speaks of a great hero. A powerful force for light, rising up to challenge the darkness. A chosen warrior of goodness bearing the true mark of courage, a Shining Emblem. It is said this hero will first appear in Ridgewood at the place where destiny and fate meet: The Footlight Bar.

One lucky audience member will be selected to quest for the Shining Emblem!  They will brave the elements, face danger and become a legend! All set to a live score!

January 29th, 9pm. The legend continues. Will you be the hero of legend? Will you side with the darkness? Or will you forge a new path? The choice is yours! Come to the Footlight Bar in Ridgewood to find out if you have the makings of a hero! Tickets only 7$!

The Emblem is calling you. Are you ready to be the hero you were born to be?

Super Bowl Party!
Doors at 5. FREE

We will be showing the game on the big screen in the back! Ross will be serving a special Super Bowl sized menu & the drinks will be flowing!

Hail Mary: Our Queer Saints is The Kennedy Center Honors for divas and deviants.

7pm @ The Footlight $5

 Hosted by Tim Kov and David Perez

Comedians, writers, and performers nominate their favorite queer icon for sainthood in order to build a new canon of glorified souls and perhaps transcend their earthly bodies!

Be there or go to hell!

Featuring:
Lucy Augustine
Justin Covington
Ryan Leach
Tessa Skara

Summary: Primitive Heart Birthday Show w/ Grisette, Johnny Butler, Sweet Tea
Description:
Primitive Heart, Grisette, Johnny Butler, Sweet Tea

Doors at 8. $10

Primitive Heart will be celebrating her birthday at The Footlight in Queens with friends.

Primitive Heart (Brooklyn)
Primitive Heart is a dreamgaze project by Dani Mari. Dani Mari is a multi-genre music producer and visual artist. Audiences across the world have gravitated toward Dani Mari's beautifully haunting voice and simplistic elegant lyrics. Her ethereal vocals "seemingly casting a spell" and transport listeners to an era of nostalgia which exists within the depths of her soul.
primitiveheartmusic.com

Grisette (Philly)
Grisette is a goddamn rock and roll band.
grisetteband.bandcamp.com

Johnny Butler (Brooklyn) performing with dancer Nicole von Arx
...Brooklyn-based Johnny Butler turns a polyphony of overdubbed horns (triggered by laptop) into Fritz Lang‚Äôs Metropolis machine. ‚Äî DownBeat Magazine
johnnybutler.com

Sweet Tea (Brooklyn)

Hex90::init()

03.10.2019 @ The Footlight
465 Seneca Avenue
Ridgewood, NY 11385
9pm ‚Äì 2am

‚Ä¢ This venue is accessible.
‚Ä¢ This venue has gender-neutral restrooms.

Dressing up is encouraged but not required.

Cover: $5.00


This space is not exclusionary, but it is an intentionally queer space. Consent and respect are not optional! Anyone being disrespectful will be removed immediately. We are against technocapitalist motives. We are a space for queer hackers, not for Silicon Valley fans. Don't piss off the hackers. ;)
